docs.snippet: Uruguay decided yesterday that the battle-damaged German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee must leave Montevideo before 6:30 tomorrow night, New York time, or be interned for the duration of the war.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay decided yesterday that the battle-damaged German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee must leave Montevideo before 6:30 tomorrow night, New York time, or be interned for the duration of the war.

headline.main: Spee's Ex-Captives Offer Proof No Gas Was Used

docs.snippet: LONDON, Dec. 15--The first bitter fruits of the naval action in which three British cruisers disabled the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee--an action that has been like a tonic to every man, woman and child in these islands-- reached here...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Dec. 15--The first bitter fruits of the naval action in which three British cruisers disabled the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee--an action that has been like a tonic to every man, woman and child in these islands-- reached here tonight in the form of the casualty list of the light cruiser Achilles.
docs.abstract: Spee track traced back by sailings of sunken ships

headline.main: LONDON GETS NEWS OF SEA FIGHT LOSS; First Casualty List From the Achilles Shows Four Men Killed, Three Wounded HIT ON BRIDGE INDICATED British Admiralty Apparently Strengthening Force to Meet Spee at Sea Again Stronger Force Awaited Indicated Track of Spee

byline.original: By ROBERT P. POST Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Saturday, Dec. 16 (AP)--In the first authoritative description of Wednesday's sea battle, the commander of the German warship Admiral Graf Spee told port authorities today that his fuel shortage and the "herding" tactics of three...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Saturday, Dec. 16 (AP)--In the first authoritative description of Wednesday's sea battle, the commander of the German warship Admiral Graf Spee told port authorities today that his fuel shortage and the "herding" tactics of three British cruisers placed him almost literally "between the devil and the deep blue sea."

headline.main: Spee Was 'Between Devil and Deep Blue Sea,' Says Captain, as Result of British Tactics

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Dec. 15--The German press charge yesterday, which found support in well-informed German quarters last night, that the British had used poison gas shells in the sea battle against the Admiral Graf Spee off the coast of Uruguay Wednesday seemed...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Dec. 15--The German press charge yesterday, which found support in well-informed German quarters last night, that the British had used poison gas shells in the sea battle against the Admiral Graf Spee off the coast of Uruguay Wednesday seemed to be dying a tactful death here today.
docs.abstract: illus of Spee wounded and Brit prisoners; por of Langsdorff

headline.main: NAZIS DROP CHARGE OF POISON SHELLS; GERMAN WOUNDED AND BRITISH PRISONERS OF THE GRAF SPEE

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Bermuda Assembly hails Brit cruisers' action
docs.abstract: Bermuda Assembly hails Brit cruisers' action

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15--Consultations have already been inaugurated among the Pan-American governments concerning the naval battle between the British and German ships off Uruguay, with a view to determining its significance in relaton to the safety...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15--Consultations have already been inaugurated among the Pan-American governments concerning the naval battle between the British and German ships off Uruguay, with a view to determining its significance in relaton to the safety belt drawn about the Western Hemisphere by the Declaration of Panama.

headline.main: AMERICAN NATIONS CONSULT ON BATTLE; Significance of the Sea Fight in Relation to the Safety Belt to Be Determined FUTURE ACTION UNCERTAIN Hull Points Out President of Panama Is the Intermediary Under the Declaration Use of Force Not Involved

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Saturday, Dec. 16--The Uruguayan Government early today announced that the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee would have to leave Montevideo by 8 P.M. [6:30 P.M. New York time] tomorrow or face internment for the duration...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Saturday, Dec. 16--The Uruguayan Government early today announced that the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee would have to leave Montevideo by 8 P.M. [6:30 P.M. New York time] tomorrow or face internment for the duration of the war.
docs.abstract: Uruguay sets time for Spee departure; learned it had protested to Germany and Brit against action within River Plate mouth and 300-mi safety zone; informs Amer govts it was subjected to strong Brit pressure on Spec's stay; diplomatic and naval qrs speculate on whether Spee Capt H Langsdorff will attempt escape or intern ship; Exeter reptd overdue at Argentine Navy base

headline.main: URUGUAY SETS TIME; Orders Reich Warship to Leave or Be Interned for War's Duration PROTESTS TO COMBATANTS Naval Patrol With Argentina to Try to Bar New Clash-- American Nations Consult Protest Handed to Envoys Joint Patrol Provided Foreign Diplomats Confer SPEE MUST DEPART TOMORROW NIGHT TEXT OF THE COMMUNIQUE British "Insisted" on Move Captain Faces Hard Decision

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 15 (UP)--The bodies of the thirty-six German navy men killed in the battle off Uruguay, Wednesday, were taken today to a common grave in the North Cemetery amid the  graves of Germans and Britons who had died here in times...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 15 (UP)--The bodies of the thirty-six German navy men killed in the battle off Uruguay, Wednesday, were taken today to a common grave in the North Cemetery amid the graves of Germans and Britons who had died here in times of peace.

headline.main: 36 GRAF SPEE DEAD BURIED IN URUGUAY; Victims of War's First Naval Battle Placed in Common Grave in Montevideo BRITONS SEND A WREATH Merchant Sailors Pay Tribute to 'Comrades'--Crowds Ban the Nazi Salute
